definition: to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: which is the L train to Bedford.
sentences.chinese: 你要坐L線地鐵到貝德福德下車。

sentences.english: This first volume reveals the crucial initial steps for getting a short film off the ground.
sentences.chinese: 這是首卷，展現了一個上下車短片關鍵的第一步。

sentences.english: You can let me out here, Topper.
sentences.chinese: 上澄，讓我在這裏下車就可以了。

sentences.english: We stop at Pin Wu for lunch, but Sam and David never come down.
sentences.chinese: 中途，司機在平武停下車喫午飯，鵬和嫣沒有下車。

sentences.english: The driver hastens next handlebar grandpa uprear, apologize again and again.
sentences.chinese: 司機趕忙下車把老大爺扶起，並連連道歉。

sentences.english: Next station is Wangjing, please get ready for your arrival.
sentences.chinese: 列車運行前方，是望京站，下車乘客請提前做好準備。

sentences.english: If you also oversleep, we'll go to the next station.
sentences.chinese: 如果你也睡過頭，我們就到下一戰下車。

sentences.english: Could you drop us off on that corner?
sentences.chinese: 您能讓我們在那個角落處下車嗎？

sentences.english: The swan soon alighted upon a lake, where he swam and dove.
sentences.chinese: 下車後不久的天鵝湖，他在那裏游泳和鴿子。

sentences.english: The next station is BEIYUAN. Please get ready for your arrival.
sentences.chinese: 列車運行前方是北苑站，下車的乘客請提前做好準備。

sentences.english: She stood up first so as to help the old lady off the bus.
sentences.chinese: 爲了攙扶那位老奶奶下車，她先站了起來。

sentences.english: I asked the bus driver to put me off near the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 我請公共汽車司機在賓館附近讓我下車。

sentences.english: You may get off at the fourth stop, then you can see the east gate of the Expo park.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在第四站下車，然後就能看到世博園的東大門。

sentences.english: Vanessa shot out of the car wielding a monkey wrench and faced the guy down.
sentences.chinese: 瓦妮莎衝下車，操着一把活動扳手把他趕跑了。

definition: to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
